abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project was
            satisfactory, the sustainability was highly unlikely, the
            institutional development impact was substantial, and the
            Bank and borrower performance were both satisfactory. Some
            of the lessons learned were that: continuity of staff on
            both sides is important for successful implementation,
            institutional memory, and avoidance of problems; the fact
            that massive externally financed fellowship programs may not
            be able to continue with domestic financing, once a
            particular project or loan comes to an end, should not
            obscure the fact that substantial benefits incur to a
            government, an economy, and a country from such training;
            and link programs, combining initial studies at a domestic
            university with completion of a program at an overseas
            university, were particularly valuable.
